content.description: Agricultural systems, such as the production of coffee, are part of a global network.
content.question:
Directions: You have 25 minutes to answer the following question. It is suggested that you take up to 5 minutes of this time to plan and outline your answer.

Describe a common characteristic shared by the coffee producing countries shown on the map.

Explain two impacts of coffee farming on producing countries.

Identify and explain one way increased coffee consumption outside of coffee growing areas affects its production.

Explain one change in the urban landscape in the developed world associated with coffee consumption.

unit.text: 5: Agriculture and Rural Land-Use Patterns and Processes

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Explain spatial relationships in a specified context or region of the world, using geographic concepts, processes, models, or theories.
